Key Match Events: India won by 8 wickets (with 46 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: India have won all seven completed T20Is against Ireland so far
Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav - their three best batters - are likely to be Nos. 1, 2 and 3
Taking them out early might be half the job done
Jasprit Bumrah holding his length back and prioritising being unhittable first
Paul Stirling to respond with calculated risks to maximise the powerplay
Kuldeep Yadav will make the most of his improved air speed by never giving up the stumps
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather in New York is perfect for cricket
India played a warm-up game here, on a different track, and they scored 180
Kohli averages 81.5 in T20 World Cups having turned 14 of his 25 innings into 50-plus scores
Bumrah has taken six wickets in 12 overs against Ireland at an average of 9.66 and economy rate of 4.83
Others: Rishabh Pant is all set to make his comeback for India
Harry Tector made his highest T20I score against India, an action-packed 64 off 33 balls
India coach Rahul Dravid is hopeful the game will acquire a new market
Ireland's George Dockrell is hoping for some support on Wednesday
